column6: andrigorouslearning\renvironment. Our staff is devoted to meeting the individual needs of our diverse population by\rfollowing the Central Unified Guiding Principles. Biola-Pershing Elementary School is located seven\rmiles west of Highway 99 in northwest Fresno of the Fresno County. It is part of a small rural\rcommunity that is involved with the rich agricultural industry and part of the Central Unified School\rDistrict. Biola-Pershing Elementary's enrollment is currently 210 students in grades TK-6. The\r--------\rdiverse student population consists of Hispanics (93.8%)

column10: CA 93722\rBiola-Pershing Elementary students qualify for free and reduced lunch. Paul
column12: there is a 21:1 student/teacher ratio in Kindergarten through 3rd grade and 28:1 ratio in\r4th to 6th grade. There is one classroom for the TK/Kindergarten level and two classrooms for our\rMs. Yesenia Z. Carrillo

Teachers participate in advanced training designed to promote specific skills and provide information related to school priorities and objectives.\rOur goal is to provide an academic environment of rigorous daily instruction for our students.
